cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Sylvan Library
cards.text: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw two additional cards. If you do, choose two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put the card on top of your library.

rulings.text: You always perform your normal draw before this ability. The normal draw occurs before anything can be placed on the stack during a player's draw step.

If you control other triggered abilities that allow you to draw cards during your draw step, you can choose to order Sylvan Library's ability before or after those abilities. Triggered abilities controlled by other players will resolve before triggered abilities you control.

Any cards drawn prior to Sylvan Library's ability resolving, including in your upkeep or in response to Sylvan Library's triggered ability, can be chosen to be put back using this effect. Sylvan Library's controller is responsible for keeping these cards distinguishable in hand, such as by keeping them separate from cards that began the turn in hand.
If you control more than one Sylvan Library, the triggered ability of each will resolve in sequence. You don't get to draw all the cards at once and then put them all back at once.
You can put back zero, one, or two cards.

If you choose to draw two cards, then replace one or more of those draws with some other effect, the rest of Sylvan Library's ability still happens. If you've actually drawn only one card that turn, you must choose that card and either pay 4 life or put it on top of your library. If you haven't actually drawn any cards that turn, the rest of the ability has no effect.
It's not possible to take any actions between drawing the cards and choosing two cards. You can't cast the cards you drew to avoid having two cards to choose.

cards.originalText: {0}: Draw two cards, then choose any two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put that card back on top of your library. Use this ability only during your draw phase and only once each turn.

cards.name: Tarpan
cards.text: When Tarpan dies, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"A good tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: If Tarpan is put into any graveyard from play, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Thicket Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the basilisk's terrible power.

rulings.text: Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk's ability because the ability is not targeted.

The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.originalText: If Thicket Basilisk blocks or is blocked by any non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Titania's Song
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Each noncreature artifact loses its abilities and is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its total casting cost. If Titania's Song leaves play, this effect continues until end of turn.

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all islands.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Venom
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."
—Maeveen O'Donagh,
Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If this Aura is moved onto a creature after blockers are declared, creatures blocking the newly-enchanted creature are not affected. This is because the ability triggers at the time blocking occurs.

cards.originalText: If enchanted creature blocks or is blocked by any non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Weave the magic so that it sings to you, and will always fly home . . . ."
—Verduran teaching
cards.originalText: {0}: Draw a card. Use this ability only when you successfully cast an enchantment spell and only once for each such spell.

cards.name: Wall of Brambles
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
cards.flavor:
Sleeping in brambles
—Elven phrase meaning
"plagued by guilt"
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate

cards.name: Wanderlust
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"How terrible to wander wishing only to escape oneself."
—Taysir
cards.originalText: During the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.name: War Mammoth
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: I didn't think mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Whirling Dervish
cards.text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

rulings.text: If it damages the opponent multiple times in a turn, it gets only one +1/+1 counter at end of turn.

cards.originalText:
Protection from black
If Whirling Dervish damages any opponent, put a +1/+1 counter on it at end of turn.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.

rulings.text: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, it produces an additional {G}.

cards.name: Winter Blast
cards.text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, King Lear

rulings.text: Winter Blast can target tapped creatures. If they have flying, the second part of the effect will still affect them.
Checks if the creatures are Flying on resolution and not on announcement. It's not a targeting restriction.

cards.originalText: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.

cards.name: Wolverine Pack
cards.text: Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.flavor:
"Give them great meals of beef and iron and steel, they will eat like wolves and fight like devils."
—William Shakespeare, King Henry V
cards.originalText: Rampage 2 (For each creature assigned to block it beyond the first, this creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Wyluli Wolf
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"When one wolf calls, others follow.
Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ambush Party
cards.text: First strike, haste
cards.flavor:
"Fair fight? I'll take survival over chivalry any day!"
—Tor Wauki, Bandit King
cards.originalText:
First strike
Ambush Party is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Atog
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The bane of all artificers, the legendary atogs devoured intricate tools to further their own twisted growth.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an artifact: +2/+2 until end of turn

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

rulings.text: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Ball Lightning is unaffected by summoning sickness.
At the end of any turn, bury Ball Lightning.

cards.name: Bird Maiden
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"Four things that never meet do here unite To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Blood Lust
cards.text: If target creature has toughness 5 or greater, it gets +4/-4 until end of turn. Otherwise, it gets +4/-X until end of turn, where X is its toughness minus 1.

rulings.text: Has changed slightly in functionality, with the old continuous nature of the toughness reduction gone away; the toughness change remains static. For example, if you have three Swamps and Nightmare on the battlefield and then cast Blood Lust on it, it will become 7/1. If one of your Swamps is subsequently destroyed, your Nightmare will become 6/0 and be put in the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/-4 until end of turn. If this reduces that creature's toughness to less than 1, the creature's toughness is 1.

cards.name: Brassclaw Orcs
cards.text: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.flavor:
"Modern Sarpadia's swarming with thrulls. It's a testament to the orcs that they've survived there so long."
—Elbieta, Argivian scholar
cards.originalText: Brassclaw Orcs cannot be assigned to block any creature with power 2 or greater.

cards.name: Brothers of Fire
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Fire is never a gentle master.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Cave People
cards.text:
Whenever Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.originalText:
If Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (If defending player controls any mountains, that creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Conquer
cards.text:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.
cards.flavor:
"Every field watered in warriors' blood is sacred ground. Lay it not to waste, but claim it for our own—for glory, and for Stromgald!"
—Avram Garrisson,
Leader of the Knights of Stromgald
cards.originalText: Gain control of enchanted land.

cards.name: Crimson Manticore
cards.text:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Manticores divide all beings into two categories: other manticores and dinner.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Detonate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

rulings.text: If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

cards.originalText: Bury target artifact with total casting cost equal to X. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.name: Disintegrate
cards.text: Disintegrate deals X damage to any target. If it's a creature, it can't be regenerated this turn, and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.

rulings.text: The "can't regenerate" is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.
Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature cannot regenerate this turn. If the creature is dealt lethal damage this turn, remove it from the game.

cards.name: Dwarven Catapult
cards.text: Dwarven Catapult deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among all creatures target opponent controls.
cards.flavor:
"Often greatly outnumbered in battle, dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

rulings.text: Count the number of creatures on resolution of the spell and divide X by that number at that time. If the number of creatures changes before resolution, the damage done may be different than what you expected.
For example, if X is 5 and the targeted opponent controls three creatures, Dwarven Catapult deals 1 damage to each of those creatures.
If the targeted opponent controls more than X creatures, no damage will be dealt to any of them.

cards.originalText: Dwarven Catapult deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among all creatures target opponent controls.

cards.name: Dwarven Soldier
cards.text: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Orc must die / Orc must die / Not an orc? / March on by."
—Dwarven marching song
cards.originalText: If Dwarven Soldier blocks or is blocked by any Orcs, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dwarven Warriors
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

rulings.text: The ability can be activated after a creature is blocked, but it has no effect. Once a creature is blocked, it can't be unblocked.
If you increase the power of the targeted creature after the ability resolves, it still can't be blocked that turn.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Errantry
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can only attack alone.
cards.flavor:
"There is no shame in solitude. The lone knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

rulings.text: "Can only attack alone" means the enchanted creature can't be declared as an attacker during the declare attackers step unless no other creatures are declared as attackers at that time (either by you or your Two-Headed Giant teammate).
If the enchanted creature attacks alone, then a spell or ability causes another creature to be put onto the battlefield attacking, that's fine.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and cannot attack during any turn in which any other creatures attack.

cards.name: Eternal Warrior
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance.
cards.flavor: Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.
cards.originalText: Attacking does not cause enchanted creature to tap.

cards.name: Fire Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Fire Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: Brimstone marks this drake's territory. Unfortunately for travelers, all of the Burning Isles smell likewise.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {R} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

rulings.text: For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its converted mana cost is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

cards.originalText: Pay {1} for each target beyond the first: Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"And topples round the dreary west
A looming bastion fringed with fire."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson,
"In Memoriam"

rulings.text: This ability can be activated by Firebreathing's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players).
The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

cards.originalText: {R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flame Spirit
cards.text: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian chieftain
cards.originalText: {R}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Flare
cards.text:
Flare deals 1 damage to any target.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor: The secret of destruction is simple: everything burns.
cards.originalText:
Flare deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn.

cards.name: Flashfires
cards.text: Destroy all Plains.
cards.originalText: Destroy all plains.

cards.name: Game of Chaos
cards.text: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 1 life and target opponent loses 1 life, and you decide whether to flip again. If you lose the flip, you lose 1 life and that opponent gains 1 life, and that player decides whether to flip again. Double the life stakes with each flip.

rulings.text: To "double the life stakes" means to double the amount of life lost or gained.

cards.originalText: Flip a coin; target opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. The loser of the flip loses 1 life. The winner of the flip gains 1 life and may choose to repeat the process. Double the stakes each time.

cards.name: Giant Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
cards.flavor:
"O! it is excellent / To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous / To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare,
Measure for Measure
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
cards.flavor:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.

cards.name: Goblin Hero
cards.flavor:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back!"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . .

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.originalText: All Goblins get +1/+1 and gain mountainwalk. (If defending player controls any mountains, these creatures are unblockable.)

cards.name: Goblin War Drums
cards.text: Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"Goblins charge with a deafening war cry. The cry doesn't mean anything—it just drowns out the drums!"
—Reod Dai, mercenary

rulings.text: When combined with an effect that reads "Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature," none of your creatures can be blocked.
Multiple War Drums are not cumulative. They are redundant.

cards.originalText: Each creature you control cannot be blocked by only one creature.

cards.name: Goblin Warrens
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor:
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

rulings.text: The token Goblins can be sacrificed to the Warrens to generate new Goblins.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three Goblin tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 red creatures.

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

cards.name: Hurloon Minotaur
cards.flavor: The minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

cards.name: Imposing Visage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor: With the horrible mask, Lagfrak the Low terrorized the countryside. But then he met Il-Chunt, the mask's model . . . .
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature cannot be blocked by only one creature.

cards.name: Incinerate
cards.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

cards.originalText: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Creatures damaged by Incinerate cannot regenerate this turn.

cards.name: Inferno
cards.text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
cards.originalText: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and player.

cards.name: Ironclaw Curse
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -0/-1.
Enchanted creature can't block creatures with power equal to or greater than the enchanted creature's toughness.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -0/-1 and cannot be assigned to block any creature with power greater than or equal to enchanted creature's toughness.

cards.name: Ironclaw Orcs
cards.text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan.
cards.originalText: Ironclaw Orcs cannot be assigned to block any creature with power 2 or greater.

cards.name: Jokulhaups
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The raging waters had swept away trees, bridges, and even houses. My healers had much work to do."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.originalText: Bury all artifacts, creatures, and lands.

cards.name: Keldon Warlord
cards.text: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.
cards.flavor: What if they threw a war, and everybody came?

rulings.text: This is a Characteristic-Defining Ability. It checks the number of non-Wall creatures you control continuously, and applies in all zones. It is never "locked in".

cards.originalText: Keldon Warlord has power and toughness each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.

cards.name: Mana Clash
cards.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

rulings.text: Always affects the player and targets one of their opponents.
Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
This card's coin flip has no winner or loser.

cards.originalText: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads at the same time.

cards.name: Mana Flare
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of any type that land produced.

rulings.text: If the land produces more than one color of mana at a single time, its controller chooses which of those types is produced by Mana Flare's ability.
The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.
When used with lands that can produce multiple colors, Mana Flare produces one additional mana of the same color that was produced. It can't give a mana of a color that wasn't produced.
Only produces extra mana when land is tapped for mana, not when tapped by some other effect.
Mana Flare adds one of whatever color the land produces after applying any land type or color changing effects.
This is a triggered mana ability.
Does not copy any restrictions on the mana, such as with Mishra's Workshop or Pillar of the Paruns.
Produces only one additional mana, regardless of how much was produced by tapping the land.

cards.originalText: Whenever any player taps a land for mana, it produces one additional mana of the same type.

cards.name: Manabarbs
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

rulings.text: This card has a triggered ability that causes a separate effect for 1 point of damage each time a land is tapped for mana.
This ability is not a mana ability. It goes on the stack and can be responded to.
The ability will trigger each time a land is tapped for mana. Each ability is separate.

If any lands are tapped for mana while a player is casting a spell or activating an ability, Manabarbs's ability will trigger that many times and wait. When the player finishes casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then Manabarbs's triggered abilities are put on the stack on top of it. The Manabarbs abilities will resolve first.

On the other hand, a player can tap lands for mana, let the Manabarbs triggered abilities be put on the stack, and then respond to those abilities by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the spell or ability will resolve first.

cards.originalText: Whenever any player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
cards.flavor: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

cards.name: Mountain Goat
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor:
"Folklore has it that to capture a mountain goat is a sign of divine blessing. I just know it's a sign that dinner is on the way."
—Klazina Jansdotter,
Leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (If defending player controls any mountains, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability doesn't resolve because the target is illegal.

cards.originalText: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Orcish Captain
cards.text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: There's a chance to win every battle.

rulings.text: You choose the target when you activate the ability. You don't flip a coin until the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {1}: Flip a coin; target opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in your favor, target Orc gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Otherwise, that Orc gets -0/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Orcish Conscripts
cards.text:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.
cards.originalText:
Orcish Conscripts cannot attack this turn unless at least two other creatures are attacking.
Orcish Conscripts cannot be assigned to block this turn unless at least two other creatures are blocking.

cards.name: Orcish Farmer
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: There is no natural disaster quite like orcish farming.

rulings.text: This ability changes the targeted land's land types. It doesn't affect its name, its supertypes (such as whether or not it's legendary, snow, or basic), or its other types (if it's also a creature, for example). The ability will cause the land to lose all of its printed abilities and gain the ability "{T}: Add {B}."

cards.originalText: {T}: Target land is a swamp until its controller's next untap phase.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Orcish Squatters
cards.text: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters assigns no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: The ability triggers on the declaration of blockers if no blockers are declared for it.
If you lose control of Orcish Squatters before its ability resolves, you won't gain control of the targeted land at all.

An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: {0}: Gain control of target land defending player controls as long as you control Orcish Squatters. Orcish Squatters deals no combat damage this turn. Use this ability only if Orcish Squatters is attacking and unblocked and only once each turn.

cards.name: Orgg
cards.text:
Trample
Orgg can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.
Orgg can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.flavor: It's bigger than it thinks.

rulings.text: Whether or not the creatures could attack or block is not important, just whether or not the defending player controls such a creature.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Orgg cannot attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.
Orgg cannot be assigned to block any creature with power 3 or greater.

cards.name: Panic
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's before the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText:
Play only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature cannot be assigned to block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn.

cards.name: Primordial Ooze
cards.text:
Primordial Ooze attacks each combat if able.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Primordial Ooze. Then you may pay {X}, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters on it. If you don't, tap Primordial Ooze and it deals X damage to you.

rulings.text: It becomes tapped even if the damage is prevented.

cards.originalText:
Primordial Ooze attacks each turn if able.
During your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Primordial Ooze. Then pay {X}, where X is equal to the number of these counters on Primordial Ooze, or tap Primordial Ooze and it deals X damage to you.

cards.name: Pyroblast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's blue.
• Destroy target permanent if it's blue.
cards.flavor:
"Just the thing for those pesky water mages."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.
Pyroblast can target any spell or permanent, not just a blue one. It checks the color of the target only on resolution.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell if it is blue, or destroy target permanent if it is blue. (If this spell targets a permanent, play it as an instant.)

cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavor:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant

rulings.text: The number of targets chosen for Pyrotechnics must be at least one and at most four. You choose how the damage is divided as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
If some but not all of Pyrotechnics's targets become illegal, you can't change the division of damage. Damage that would have been dealt to illegal targets simply isn't dealt.
If an effect creates a copy of Pyrotechnics, the number of targets and division of damage can't be changed. The effect that creates the copy may allow you to change the targets, however.

cards.originalText: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided any way you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Sabretooth Tiger
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor:
"I fear anything with teeth measured in handspans!"
—Norin the Wary
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Shatterstorm
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.
cards.originalText: Bury all artifacts.

cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: While it's true most dragons are cruel, the Shivan dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Smoke
cards.text: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.

rulings.text: Animated lands are affected by this spell. If on the battlefield with an effect that limits the number of land you untap, untapping an animated land will count as the one creature and the one land you can untap... thereby limiting you to one thing to be untapped.

cards.originalText: Players cannot untap more than one creature during their untap phases.

cards.name: Stone Giant
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: If the Giant's power and/or toughness change so that its toughness is less than its power, you can have the ability target the Giant itself.
To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

If Stone Giant's ability is activated during a turn's end step, the delayed triggered ability won't trigger until the beginning of the next turn's end step. The targeted creature will be destroyed at that time.

When the delayed triggered ability resolves, the targeted creature is destroyed, even if it's no longer a creature, no longer under your control, or no longer has toughness less than Stone Giant's power at that time.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. At end of turn, destroy that creature.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Stone Spirit
cards.text: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian chieftain

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) can block this because they don't actually have Flying.

cards.originalText: Stone Spirit cannot be blocked by creatures with flying.

cards.name: The Brute
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: After years of being bullied, Fergo reaped the benefits of his newfound strength: he never met a man he didn't want to fight.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Struggle, and you will only fan the flames."
—Talibah, embermage
cards.originalText: {R}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Wall of Stone
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: The ground itself lends its strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

cards.name: Winds of Change
cards.text: Each player shuffles the cards from their hand into their library, then draws that many cards.
cards.flavor:
"'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales, Which tell us the way to go."
—Ella Wheeler Wilcox, "Winds of Fate"

rulings.text: Each player draws a number of cards equal to the number of cards they shuffled into their own library.

cards.originalText: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her library, then draws a new hand of as many cards as he or she had before.

cards.name: Word of Blasting
cards.text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.
cards.flavor:
"Walls? What walls?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
cards.originalText: Bury target Wall. Word of Blasting deals to that Wall's controller an amount of damage equal to the Wall's total casting cost.

cards.name: Abbey Gargoyles
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"They don't move, do they?"
"Only for the wrong sort of people."
"Are we the wrong sort of people?"
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from red

cards.name: Akron Legionnaire
cards.text: Except for creatures named Akron Legionnaire and artifact creatures, creatures you control can't attack.

rulings.text: If you have two or more Legionnaires, they can all attack.

cards.originalText: Except for Legionnaires and artifact creatures, creatures you control cannot attack.

cards.name: Alabaster Potion
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains X life.
• Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor:
Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity.
—D'Avenant proverb
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life, or prevent X damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Angry Mob
cards.text:
Trample
As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.
cards.originalText:
Trample
During your turn, Angry Mob has power and toughness each equal to 2 plus the number of swamps all opponents control. During other turns, Angry Mob has power and toughness each equal to 2.

cards.name: Animate Wall
cards.text:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor:
"When you have been bitten with fangs of granite, you start to long for the ivory sabers of tigers."
—Norin the Wary

rulings.text: This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Animate Wall can now enchant only a Wall.

cards.originalText:
Play only on a Wall.
Enchanted creature can attack as though it were not a Wall.

cards.name: Arenson's Aura
cards.text:
{W}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Destroy target enchantment.
{3}{U}{U}: Counter target enchantment spell.
cards.flavor:
"Cloak me in mystery, hide my names from my enemies, and let me draw from the well of power."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.originalText:
{W}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Destroy target enchantment.
{3}{U}{U}: Counter target enchantment spell. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Armor of Faith
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Keep your chain mail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Aysen Bureaucrats
cards.text: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.
cards.flavor:
"When one's word is law, one's whim is equally binding."
—Calmont, Aysen bureaucrat

rulings.text: This checks the power of the creature on activation and on resolution.

cards.originalText: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.

cards.name: Benalish Hero
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the Hero.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding

cards.name: Blessed Wine
cards.text:
You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Out there, there are spirits, but here, there is wine."
—Blessing for the bounty of Kjeld
cards.originalText:
Gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn.

cards.name: Blinking Spirit
cards.text: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician
cards.originalText: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to owner's hand.

cards.name: Brainwash
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.flavor: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

rulings.text: This ability is paid for during the declare attackers step of the combat phase.
If there are multiple combat phases during the turn, the attack cost must be paid each time if you want to attack with the creature.
Paying this cost is not an instant or any other kind of ability, it is an additional cost on the declaration of the attacker.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature cannot attack this turn unless its controller pays an additional {3}.
